Module yae.window

Provides an interface for modifying and retrieving information about the program's window.

Functions

fromPixels (px, py) Converts a number from pixels to density-independent units.

Functions

fromPixels (px, py)
Converts a number from pixels to density-independent units.

Parameters:

  • px number The x-axis value of a coordinate in pixels.
  • py number The y-axis value of a coordinate in pixels.

Returns:

  1. number x The converted x-axis value of the coordinate, in density-independent units.
  2. number y The converted y-axis value of the coordinate, in density-independent units.

Usage:

    x, y = yae.window.fromPixels px, py
getDisplayModes ()
Gets a list of supported display modes.

Returns:

    table modes A table of width/height pairs. (Note that this may not be in order.)

Usage:

    modes = yae.window.getDisplayModes!
getMode ()
Gets the display mode and properties of the window.

Returns:

  1. number width Window width
  2. number height Window height
  3. number fullscreen True if window is fullscreen

Usage:

    width, height, fullscreen = yae.window.getMode!
getHeight ()
Gets the height of the window.

Returns:

    number The height of the window.

Usage:

    height = yae.window.getHeight!
getPixelScale ()
Gets the DPI scale factor associated with the window. In Mac OS X with the window in a retina screen and the highdpi window flag enabled this will be 2.0, otherwise it will be 1.0.

Returns:

    number The pixel scale factor associated with the window.

Usage:

    scale = yae.window.getPixelScale!
getTitle ()
Gets the window title.

Returns:

    string The current window title.

Usage:

    title = yae.window.getTitle!
getWidth ()
Gets the width of the window.

Returns:

    number The width of the window.

Usage:

    width = yae.window.getWidth!
isFullscreen ()
Gets whether the window is fullscreen.

Returns:

    bool True if the window is fullscreen, false otherwise.

Usage:

    fullscreen = yae.window.isFullscreen!
setFullscreen (fullscreen)
Enters or exits fullscreen. The display to use when entering fullscreen is chosen based on which display the window is currently in, if multiple monitors are connected.

Parameters:

  • fullscreen bool Whether to enter or exit fullscreen mode.

Usage:

    yae.window.setFullscreen fullscreen
setMode (width, height[, fullscreen=false])
Sets the display mode and properties of the window.

Parameters:

  • width number Display width.
  • height number Display height.
  • fullscreen bool Fullscreen (true), or windowed (false). (default false)

Usage:

    yae.window.setMode width, height, fullscreen
setTitle (title)
Sets the window title. Do not works on Android and iOS.

Parameters:

  • title string The new window title.

Usage:

    yae.window.setTitle title
toPixels (x, y)
Converts a number from density-independent units to pixels.

Parameters:

  • x number The x-axis value of a coordinate in density-independent units to convert to pixels.
  • y number The y-axis value of a coordinate in density-independent units to convert to pixels.

Returns:

  1. number px The converted x-axis value of the coordinate, in pixels.
  2. number py The converted y-axis value of the coordinate, in pixels.

Usage:

    px, py = yae.window.toPixels x, y
